svg.text: Comprehensive Roadmap: From Foundations to Advanced Automation
svg.desc: Detailed DevSecOps Learning Path Description: 1. Foundations: Focus on Linux operating system fundamentals, file systems, permissions, and shell scripting (Bash). Understand networking concepts like OSI model, TCP/IP, DNS, HTTP/HTTPS, and SSL/TLS. Learn basic coding in Python or Go for automation. 2. CI/CD Pipeline: Master Git for version control including branching strategies (Git Flow). Learn Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery principles. Build pipelines using GitHub Actions, Jenkins, or GitLab CI. Treat pipeline configuration as code. 3. Security Integration: Integrate security into the pipeline. Use Static Application Security Testing (SAST) tools like SonarQube. Use Dynamic Application Security Testing (DAST) tools like OWASP ZAP. Implement Software Composition Analysis (SCA) to check dependencies. Scan container images with Trivy or Clair. 4. Cloud & Kubernetes: Understand cloud providers (AWS, Azure, GCP) and their security models (Shared Responsibility). Master Docker for containerization. Learn Kubernetes architecture, pods, services, deployments, and security contexts. Use kubectl effectively. 5. Observability: Implement monitoring using Prometheus. Visualize data with Grafana. Centralize logging with ELK stack (Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana) or Fluentd. specific tools like Falco for runtime security monitoring. Understand the three pillars: Logs, Metrics, and Traces. 6. Automation & IaC: Use Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools like Terraform or CloudFormation. Implement Configuration Management with Ansible. Use GitOps tools like ArgoCD. Enforce policies using Open Policy Agent (OPA). Automate security remediation where possible. Resources include certifications like CKA (Certified Kubernetes Administrator), CKS (Certified Kubernetes Security Specialist), OSCP (Offensive Security Certified Professional). Practice on platforms like HackTheBox, TryHackMe, and VulnHub.
